solution_line_template: August solved a math problem that had an answer twice as big as the answer of the first math problem, meaning the next answer was {first_answer}*{twice} = <<{first_answer}*{twice}={second_answer}>>{second_answer}
The first math problem and the second math problem has answers totaling {second_answer}+{first_answer} = <<{second_answer}+{first_answer}={sum_first_second}>>{sum_first_second}

The third math problem had an answer 400 less than the combined total answers of the first and the second math problems, meaning the third answer was {sum_first_second}-{less_amount} = <<{sum_first_second}-{less_amount}={third_answer}>>{third_answer}
Altogether, the math problems that August solved on his computer had answers totaling {sum_first_second}+{third_answer}= <<{sum_first_second}+{third_answer}={total}>>{total}
